any.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: some or even the smallest amount or number
any.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Do you need any further information?
They haven’t shown any interest at all in my research.
The universities have shown few if any signs of a willingness to change.
Are any of the paintings for sale?
They didn’t invite any of us.
any.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used to refer to a person or thing of a particular type when what you are saying is true of all people or things of that type
any.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Any child who breaks the rules will be punished.
Always check the details carefully before you sign any written agreement.
I can see you any time on Monday.
If I can help in any way, let me know.
This excuse was as good as any other.
You can choose any of the books on the list.
any.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: They’re going to need any help they can get.
any.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used before the comparative form of an adjective to mean ‘even a small amount’
any.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: used with a verb to mean ‘at all’
any.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: We tried talking to him but that didn’t help any.
